Summary: Awards based on total stars across all repositories. Simple linear progression with increasing gaps between ranks.
Based on total commit contributions (public + restricted). Uses doubling/quadrupling progression pattern.
Counts total follower count. Progression roughly doubles between ranks.
Sum of open and closed issues created. Doubling pattern with threshold jumps.
Total PRs authored. Same progression pattern as Issues trophy.
Total number of repositories owned. Very tight progression at high ranks with only 10-repo gaps.
PR review contributions. Irregular progression with tighter gaps than most trophies.
**ANOMALY**: Uses scaled duration metric that's divided by 100 days. Ranks progress non-linearly.
Unlocked when user has used 10+ unique programming languages across repositories.
**ANOMALY**: Unlocked only when ALL base trophies (Stars/Commits/Followers/Issues/PRs/Repos/Reviews) achieve S-rank or higher.
Unlocked for accounts created in/before 2008 (GitHub's founding year).
Unlocked for accounts created in exactly 2020.
**UNUSED**: Based on duration in years but requires 10+ years.
